text: I enjoy reading the Japanese version.

Hello everyone! I'm having issues with tracking users in the funnel Google SEM -> HubSpot Landing page -> Custom webapp. I'm missing source and other information crucial to monitor the performance. Anyone here who'd like to lend a hand or point me to the right channel to delve deeper?

Thanks for your comments and explanations - I am much more of a backend guy so I don't work on front end all that much and since things do change rapidly in our line of work I appreciate your insight!
Yes I have seen that happen several times over the year.
I am also getting the Japanese version, been trying to get it fixed but can not figure out the reason why it's setting that language anywhere

Hi everyone, i have a client that faces this error when using E-Signature with HelloSign ( now DropboxSign).  I also heard from another user that they are facing the same issues.

After clicking of "verify to sign" I see the screen stating "Your identity has been verified." - However, when i click on "Start signing" i am seeing the error message. The monthly limit is not exceeded yet, it is at 9/50.

 I suspect that something went wrong when switching from HelloSign to DropboxSign, but they don´t want me to help because they say it is an HubSpot issue.

Hey <@UJAPS2K4N> , this is great. 
Unfortunately I don't think we have the Design Manager required to enable this.

We’ve had this exact same issue! As a HubSpot partner we thought it would be great if we used the quotes tool ourselves to showcase it to our clients.
Not sure it’s very well showcased when 2 of our clients have had the same issue trying to sign our quotes!

I'm getting this error: Error:text field 'style.card.border_radius' is not allowed in the 'STYLE' tab

Am I really not allowed to use a text field in the Style tab fields? I wanted to be able to accommodate something like 0px 0px 20px 20px instead of making a separate number field for each.

only certain fields are allowed in the style tab, Text field is not one of them. From the documentation:

The following fields can be used as style fields in modules. Learn about each of the field types in the module and field types guide.

Alignment
Gradient
Spacing
Background Image
Border
Boolean
Choice
Number
Color
Icon
Image
Font
Text Alignment
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields-overview#style-fields>
But there's no border radius or spacing component, even though I've seen it in rows in the DND editor?
spacing is nr 3 in the list
It's not showing up for me
the style tab fields are going to added below that
there is "fields or grouped fields" and below there is a section for style fields
with and orange button
I am editing style fields
I can make a quick video to show you what I'm seeing if it helps.

hi all. Not sure where best to drop this so I'm starting here; happy to post elsewhere.

I'm just getting started with UI Extensions and have the sample from github to open an iframe. Is it possible to pass contact information into the URI?
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1nVHKYE77fz2CXAl1fFUgUW3JgtWLbkAk/view?usp=sharing>
I just submitted a support ticket with HubSpot as well, as maybe this is a bug ?
Trying to relate the traffic on our site compared to companies in our database. Is there a way to see the actual pages viewed as a whole? Instead of drilling into a contact one by one?

Hey team! Can we get this idea upvoted?? Basically the idea is to add a time tracker to objects like deals to account for billable hours: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/A-time-tracking-tool-to-track-billable-hours/idi-p/350254#comment-on-this>

Hey Jeff - <#C05R599UA12|ui-extensions> is the channel specific to this functionality.

But to answer - yes, you can do something like string concatenation / template literals to pass in context data / object data through the iFrame URI.

The 'context' tells you about the account + user + the object type object ID. You can also use the `fetchCrmObjectProperties` action to get data about the current record, and you could pass that into your URL. This sample shows how you can do that: <https://github.com/HubSpot/ui-extensions-examples/blob/main/bi-directional-property-refresh/src/app/extensions/PropertyRefreshExtension.tsx>

• <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/crm/ui-extensions/overview#working-with-data>
• <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/crm/ui-extensions/create#fetch-account-and-user-information>
Here's an example of the result of the above code
<@UJJ239SC9> much appreciated! Thank you!
For me putting the CSS through a validator seemed to fix the issue

*Tracking buyer personas per target accounts.* 

We have a set of ICP accounts (as you probably have too). And we have 5-6 identified buyer personas (there is a Persona field on contacts that tells with persona that contact is).
I'd like to track on the company level if a certain persona exists (so there is a minimum of 1 contact in a persona) or not on the account. Simply to see where the gaps are. Which persona we are missing in each account.

How would you go about this? How would you aggregate this contact level data up to the company level?
Ideally it would be a single field listing the available personas in the account or 1 field per persona (true/false) that shows if that persona exists on the account or not.

I don't know if a calculated field would even be capable to do this. I'm assuming not. But then I am unsure how this could be done. Any ideas?

Hey <@U07FBTXPE2V>,
you're welcome.
The Design-Manager is a feature, that is available in every portal. It's nothing you can't have.
The only reason that you might not be able to see it is, that you don't have permissions to access it.
If you're not familiar with HubSpot development, Hubl and such - I would recommend to not change anything there because it might break some stuff. As mentioned in the <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C016CS822C9/p1723563287763309?thread_ts=1723563034.979709&cid=C016CS822C9|other thread>, I'd recommend to create a seperate environment, develop things there and, once it's finished, move/recreate it in the live portal.

Also - if you need developer support -> feel free to drop me a DM. I'm happy to help
This is a bizarre and known bug! I can get y'all sorted out if you send me your HubSpot Usernames (AKA the name that shows up when you post)
Hi <@U07DPPQCMQS>, found any solution?
Nope
Does anyone have a HubSpot Landing Page leading into a custom webapp? If so how did you setup tracking without having users provide their email in a form on the Landing Page?

this seems bizarre to me… have you folks touched base with our Support team on this one? this feels like it oughta be escalated there if not

Howdy everyone. So this may be a silly question but hopefully that'll make it easy to answer :wink:
I am trying to hit a serverless function residing in a private app I've made for our HubSpot Tickets CRM cards. I've found online that I need to specify an endpoint to hit with a POST request and I've done such but was hit with the *"your HubSpot plan doesnt include endpoint for app functions"*.
So I guess my question is: Is upgrading our HubSpot plan the only way to POST to serverless functions? (at which point the private app would update some info in our tickets portal)
<@U04U9UFTKNJ> i have written a DM :slightly_smiling_face:
